title: Variance and Standard Deviation of Discrete Random Variables
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to calculate the variance and standard deviation of a discrete random variable.

problem.statementHtml: Suppose we have a discrete random variable X that takes on the values 0, 1, and 2 with probabilities 1/4, 1/2, and 1/4 respectively. Calculate the variance and standard deviation of X.
problem.solutionHtml:
We can start by calculating the expected value of X:

  • E[X] = (0)(1/4) + (1)(1/2) + (2)(1/4) = 3/4

Next, we'll calculate the variance:

  • Variance = E[(X - E[X])^2] = E[(X - 3/4)^2]
  • = ((0-3/4)^2)(1/4) + ((1-3/4)^2)(1/2) + ((2-3/4)^2)(1/4)
  • = (-15/16)(1/4) + (1/16)(1/2) + (9/16)(1/4)
  • = -3/16 + 1/32 + 9/64
  • = 5/16

Finally, we can calculate the standard deviation:

  • Standard Deviation = sqrt(Variance) = sqrt(5/16) = \sqrt{5}/4

subject: probability
title: Variance and Standard Deviation of Discrete Random Variables
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll explore how to calculate the variance and standard deviation of a discrete random variable.

problem.statementHtml: Find the variance and standard deviation of a discrete random variable X with probability mass function P(X=1) = 0.4, P(X=2) = 0.3, and P(X=3) = 0.3.
problem.solutionHtml:
We first calculate the mean:

  • E[X] = (1)(0.4) + (2)(0.3) + (3)(0.3) = 2

Then, we expand the variance formula:

  • \[ \sigma^2 = E[(X - E[X])^2] = E[(X-2)^2] \]

We calculate each term:

  • E[(1-2)^2] = 0.4
  • E[(2-2)^2] = 0.3
  • E[(3-2)^2] = 0.3

Finally, we sum and simplify:

  • \[ \sigma^2 = 0.4 + 0.3 + 0.3 = 1 \]

The standard deviation is the square root of the variance:

  • \[ \sigma = \sqrt{1} = 1 \]
